notes: The model failed to identify the critical access control vulnerability in openTroveAndMigrate. The vulnerability allows an attacker to specify an arbitrary 'account' (victim) in the openTroveAndMigrate function. If the victim has previously granted delegate approval to the MigrateTroveZap contract (a common pattern for such helper contracts), the attacker can open a trove on the victim's behalf, using the victim's collateral, while the minted debt tokens (mkUSD) are sent to the attacker (msg.sender) on line 93.
